docs.title: A Hedge Fund Manager’s Lament
docs.text:
O thou who seek within the laws abiding, In which the spirit’d souls of quick mind delves, When, in avarice blind, their passion shelves, For great funds of symmetry subsiding - A plight with dreams no longer colliding, And to chase the yield, a fate it impels, Towards the sole discovery it compels, Boneless and broken in this residing! Yet now I see the spinor to be spun, To unravel the celestial lore, And whilst stars narrate how our tales begun, It is particles I wish to explore - Though finance whispers, in physics I hum, Within these wonders, I’ll seek evermore.

Benjamin Gladwyn
